ETYMOLOGY: From Latin chrysanthemum, from Ancient Greek khrusánthemon (χρυσάνθεμον), from khrusós (χρυσός, 'gold') + ánthos (ἄνθος, 'flower').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A widely cultivated ornamental plant, especially a hybrid, bred from species of the genus *Chrysanthemum*, having finely divided leaves and often showy, brightly colored flowers.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种广泛栽培的观赏植物，特别是杂交种，源自菊属植物，具有细裂的叶子和通常艳丽、色彩鲜艳的花朵。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The garden was full of vibrant chrysanthemums in autumn.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 秋天的花园里开满了鲜艳的菊花。
